P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.desc: Represents the name of the reference for the bottom of this baluster or post.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.remarks: Two pre-defined reference names can be obtained using [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::BalusterInfo::getReferenceNameForHost()] or [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::BalusterInfo::getReferenceNameForTopRail()]. The rest of valid reference names that are allowed to be used in the setter for BaseReferenceName are the actual names of non-continuous rails [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::NonContinuousRailInfo::Name] in [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::NonContinuousRailStructure]

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.RoomTag.title: RoomTagFilter Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.RoomTag.desc: A filter used to match room tags.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.RoomTag.remarks: This filter is a slow filter, but it uses a quick filter to eliminate non-candidate elements before the elements are obtained and expanded. Therefore this filter does not have to be paired with another quick filter to minimize the number of Elements that are expanded.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.title: TopographyEditScope Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.desc: A TopographyEditScope allows an application to create and maintain an editing session for a TopographySurface.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: Start/end of a TopographyEditScope will start/end a transaction group. After a TopographyEditScope is started, an application can start transactions and edit the topography surface. Individual transactions the application creates inside TopographyEditScope will not appear in the undo menu. All transactions committed during the edit mode will be merged into a single one which will bear the given name passed into TopographyEditScope constructor.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRun.BeginsWithRiser Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: True if the stairs run begins with a riser, false otherwise.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.remarks: If selected, Revit adds a riser to the beginning of the run. If you clear this option, Revit removes the beginning riser and positions the adjacent tread at the base elevation. Clearing this option will change the number of risers in the run. You will need to manually add a riser to maintain the original height.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: Creates a spiral run in the project document by providing the center, start angle and included angle.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.sig:
public static StairsRun CreateSpiralRun(
	Document document,
	ElementId stairsId,
	XYZ center,
	double radius,
	double startAngle,
	double includedAngle,
	bool clockwise,
	StairsRunJustification justification
)
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.remarks: The new stairs run and the document will be regenerated. This should be run from within an open transaction.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.title: TopographySurface.MovePoint Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.desc: Moves a point in a TopographySurface to a new designated location.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: If targetPt exists, the movedPt will be deleted. That means if movedPoint is moved to become a duplicate of an existing point, movedPoint will be deleted instead becuase both points cannot exist at the same location. This applies to a TopographySurface element (not a SiteSubRegion or a topography surface associated with a BuildingPad), which shoule be in an active TopographyEditScope.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRun.ExtensionBelowRiserBase Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: Specifies a value to extend/trim the run's first step against base elevation of the stairs if the stairs begins with a riser.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.remarks: This is useful in cases where the run attaches to the face of a floor opening rather than resting on the surface of the floor. Negative value extends the run's first step below the stairs' base elevation. Positive value trims it above the stairs' base elevation. This value should not be greater than run's top elevation.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.RoomFil.remarks: This filter is a slow filter, but it uses a quick filter to eliminate non-candidate elements before the elements are obtained and expanded. Therefore this filter does not have to be paired with another quick filter to minimize the number of Elements that are expanded.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.desc:
Checks if the given level can be disconnected from multistory stairs.
   You cannot disconnect the levels of standard stair (the stair associated with the Reference Level for the multistory stairs) or already disconnected.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.title: BalusterInfo.BaseOffset Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.desc: The offset from the base reference.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsL.title: StairsLanding.CreateAutomaticLanding Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsL.desc: Creates automatic landing(s) between two stairs runs.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsL.remarks: This should be called within open stairs edit scope and transaction. The new stairs landing(s) and the document will be regenerated. The landing type of the new stairs landing(s) is determined by stairs type.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.SiteSub.desc: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.SiteSub.remarks: If the corresponding Revit native object is destroyed, or creation of the corresponding object is undone, a managed API object containing it is no longer valid. API methods cannot be called on invalidated wrapper objects.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Railing.title: Railing.HostId Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Railing.remarks: If the host will be a Stairs in MultistoryStairs element, use [M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Railing.SetMultistoryStairsPlacementLevels(System.Collections.Generic.ISet`1{Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementId})] to set the base levels of the stairs where the railing should be placed. If %hostId% is the id of a Stairs Component (Run or Landing), it means that the Railing will be hosted by the Stairs element but railing adjustment to the stairs will start from the Component. If a stairs id is set as a host, the lowest stairs component below or above the railing sketch will be chosen as the host instead.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRun.ExtensionBelowTreadBase Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: Specifies a value to extend/trim the run's first step against base elevation of the stairs if the stairs begins with a tread.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.remarks: This is useful in cases where the run attaches to the face of a floor opening rather than resting on the surface of the floor. Negative value extends the run's first step below the stairs' base elevation. Positive value trims it above the stairs' base elevation. This value should not be greater than run's top elevation.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.title: TopographySurface Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: TopographySurface and related classes have been replaced as of Revit 2024 with Toposolid and related classes. It is recommended that all newly created elements and modifications operate from the new Toposolid class. The TopographySurface element remains in the API for backwards compatibility and upgrade. A TopographySurface element in the Revit API represents: An actual topography surface which can have an arbitrary boundary and collection of points.A SiteSubRegion element bounded by a sketch.A topography surface created automatically by the introduction of a BuildingPad element. Identify a subregion with the IsSiteSubRegion property, and access the object that provides interfaces to manipulate the subregion via AsSiteSubRegion(). Identify a topography surface associated with a building pad with the isAssociatedWithBuildingPad property, and access the associated BuildingPad element via the property AssociatedBuildingPadId. If the element does represent a subregion or a topography surface associated with a building pad, some methods of this class are inapplicable.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.title: BalusterInfo.TopReferenceName Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.desc: Represents the name of the reference for the top of this baluster or post.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.remarks: Two pre-defined reference names can be obtained using [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::BalusterInfo::getReferenceNameForHost()] or [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::BalusterInfo::getReferenceNameForTopRail()]. The rest of valid reference names that are allowed to be used in the setter for TopReferenceName are the actual names of non-continuous rails [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::NonContinuousRailInfo::Name] in [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Architecture::NonContinuousRailStructure]

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsT.title: StairsType.MaxRiserHeight Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsT.desc: The maximum height of each riser on the stair element.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRun.GetStairs Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: Returns the stairs to which the stairs run belongs.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsP.title: StairsPath.TextOrientation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsP.desc: The orientation of stair up and down text.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.NonCont.title: NonContinuousRailStructure.IsValidObject Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.NonCont.desc: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.NonCont.remarks: If the corresponding Revit native object is destroyed, or creation of the corresponding object is undone, a managed API object containing it is no longer valid. API methods cannot be called on invalidated wrapper objects.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsT.title: StairsType.RightSideSupportType Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsT.desc: The type of right support used in the stair.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.title: MultistoryStairs.ActualTreadDepth Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.desc: The actual depth of the stairs treads in the stairs, actual tread depth is equal to minimum tread depth by default.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.remarks: In a multistory stairs, all the stairs elements keep the same tread depth parameter value.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Continu.title: ContinuousRailType.EndOrTopTermination Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Continu.desc: The termination of the rail at the end or top.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.title: MultistoryStairs Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.desc: Represents a multistory stairs element in Autodesk Revit.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.remarks: A multistory stairs element may contain multiple stairs whose extents are governed by base and top levels. Use [M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.MultistoryStairs.ConnectLevels(System.Collections.Generic.ISet`1{Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementId})] and [M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.MultistoryStairs.DisconnectLevels(System.Collections.Generic.ISet`1{Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementId})] to add and remove connected levels to a multistory stairs element.This element will contain one or more Stairs elements. These can be obtained via GetAllStairsIds and GetStairsOnLevel(ElementId). Stairs elements are either a reference instance which is copied to each level covered by groups of identical stairs instances which share the same level height, or individual Stairs instances which are not connected to a group with the same level height. By default, when adding new levels to the multistory stair, new stairs will be added to the group (shown in the Revit user interface with a 'Pin' icon). For groups of duplicate stairs at different levels, the instances can be found as Subelements of the Stairs element (see GetSubelements. Stairs in a connected group can be edited together by modifying the associated Stairs instance. For specific floors that need special designs, stairs can be separated from a group by unpinning the element, changes made to this Stairs will not affect other any other instance in the element. Use Unpin(ElementId) for this. You can add the stairs back into the group via Pin(ElementId) if needed. However, any changes made to the stair will be lost since the stair's properties will be overridden by the group specifications.

props.d: The actual depth of the stairs treads in the stairs, actual tread depth is equal to minimum tread depth by default.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.NonCont.desc:
Creates and appends a new Non-Continuous Rail to the Rail Structure.
   The new Non-Continuous Rail will have the given name, height and offset.
   It will have default profile and material ElementIds.

props.d: The id of the family used for the baluster or post.
The offset from the base reference.
Represents the name of the reference for the bottom of this baluster or post.

The length, in case of balusters, it is a distance from a previous one.
   For a post, it is a space from the original position of the post.

Represents the name of the reference for the top of this baluster or post.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsL.title: StairsLanding.GetStairsPath Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsL.desc: Returns the stairs path curves on the landing. The curves are projected on the stairs base level.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRun.BaseElevation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: The base elevation of the stairs run.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.remarks: The base elevation has following restrictions: The base elevation is relative to the base elevation of the stairs to which the stairs run belongs.When setting this property the value will be rounded automatically to a multiple of the riser height.When setting this property for common run, the run's height will change according to the new base/top elevation. So the value must be less than the top elevation to keep run valid.When setting this property for sketched run, whose height is fixed, the run's top elevation will be adjusted to keep the same run height.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsP.title: StairsPathType.StartSymbolTypeId Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsP.desc: The start symbol type of stairs path.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRunType.TreadProfile Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: The id of the profile of the treads.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Railing.desc: True if the railing can be reset, False otherwise.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Railing.remarks: A Railing can be reset only if the railing was created in Revit later than version 9.1.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Stairs..title: Stairs.ActualTreadDepth Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Stairs..desc: The actual depth of the stairs treads in the stairs, actual tread depth is equal to minimum tread depth by default.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Stairs..title: Stairs.IsByComponent Method

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.title: BalusterPlacement.IsValidObject Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.desc: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.remarks: If the corresponding Revit native object is destroyed, or creation of the corresponding object is undone, a managed API object containing it is no longer valid. API methods cannot be called on invalidated wrapper objects.

public static StairsRun CreateSketchedRun(

)

props.d: The condition which controls breaking baluster patterns distribution.
Determines how baluster pattern distribution is justified.
The extra space added after a whole baluster pattern.

The id of a Baluster family used to fill excess length, which is the extra space
   along the railing segment that cannot be filled with a pattern.
   If set to InvalidElementId, it will be the default - the id of the BaseRailingAttr containing the Baluster pattern.
The value defines the spacing between each baluster instance inserted in the excess length.
Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
The length of the main baluster pattern.
The angle between neighboring railing segments which conditions breaking patterns distribution along a railing path.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: The given point will be evaluated in XYZ. If a point matches the XY location, but not the elevation, this function still returns false. This applies to TopographySurface and SiteSubRegion elements.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsT.desc: The join style between a run and landing.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Stairs..title: Stairs.ActualRiserHeight Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Stairs..desc: The actual height of the stairs risers in the stairs.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Stairs..remarks: The stairs height is determined by its base and top elevation. So, the actual riser height = stairs height / desired riser number.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRun.TopElevation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: The top elevation of the stairs run.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.remarks: The top elevation has following restrictions: The top elevation is relative to the base elevation of the stairs to which the stairs run belongs.When setting this property the value will be rounded automatically to a multiple of the riser height.When setting this property for common run, the run's height will change according to the new base/top elevation. So the value must be greater than base elevation to keep run valid.When setting this property for sketched run, whose height is fixed, the run's base elevation will be adjusted to keep the same run height.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.title: TopographyEditScope.Start Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.desc: Starts a topography surface edit mode for an existing TopographySurface element.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: The application will need to start a transaction to actually make changes to the TopographySurface element. TopographyEditScope can only be started when there is no transaction active, thus it does not work for commands running in automatic transaction mode. Like all Start methods in any edit scope object this too returns an Id of the element in the edit session, even though in this case here it always equals to the given topoSurfaceId.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.title: StairsRun.EndsWithRiser Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.desc: True if the stairs run ends with a riser, false otherwise.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsR.remarks: If selected, Revit adds a riser to the end of the run. Clearing this option will change the number of risers in the run. You will need to manually add or remove risers to maintain the original height.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.sig: public IList<ElementId> GetHostedSubRegionIds()
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: This applies to a TopographySurface element (not a SiteSubRegion or a topography surface associated with a BuildingPad). This applies to TopographySurface and SiteSubRegion elements.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsL.desc:
Checks whether automatic landing(s) can be created between the given two stairs runs and
   logically join(s) with the stairs runs.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.StairsL.remarks: This only checks whether two stairs runs meet restriction to create automatic landing(s) without checking the stairs edit scope and document modifiable.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.desc: Identifies whether the given point is an existing boundary point of the current topography surface.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: This applies to TopographySurface, SiteSubRegion, and the topography surface associated with a BuildingPad element. The given point will be evaluated in XYZ. If a point matches the XY location, but not the elevation, an ArgumentException will be thrown if this point does not exist in current topography surface.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.desc: The id of baluster per tread family.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Baluste.remarks: The property defines a baluster family type which is used for creation of balusters on treads. The number of such balusters is set by "BalusterPerTreadNumber" property. It works only for stairs which have treads and have "UseBalusterPerTreadOnStairs" set.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.BreakPa.title: BreakPatternCondition Enumeration
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.BreakPa.desc: Condition on which patterns distribution will be broken.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.title: MultistoryStairs.Unpin Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.desc: Removes a particular story of the stairs (identified by its base level id) from a stairs group.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Multist.remarks: If the story at the given level is in a group, it will separate an individual stairs element from the group with "unpinned" status. Changes you make to the returned stairs element will not affect any other stairs. If the story of stairs is already an individual stairs element, the status will be changed to "unpinned".

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.title: TopographySurface.GetPoints Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.desc: Gets the points that define this topography surface.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.sig: public IList<XYZ> GetPoints()
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: This applies to TopographySurface, SiteSubRegion, and the topography surface associated with a BuildingPad element. For a SiteSubRegion, this returns the points from a representation of the region's boundary as well as the points inherited from the host TopographySurface. For the topography surface associated with a BuildingPad element, this returns the points from the sketch of this topography surface(there are no interior points for this topography surface).

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.Topogra.remarks: This applies to TopographySurface, SiteSubRegion, and the topography surface associated with a BuildingPad element. For the topography surface associated with a BuildingPad element, this returns the points from the sketch of this topography surface.
